name: Hampton Inn Greenville I-385 - Woodruff Rd.

reviews.text: I read the reviews and had to see it for myself --- it's all true...
reviews.title: The cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at.

reviews.text: The hotel staff was awesome.
reviews.title: Great customer service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was great!
reviews.title: Tops in service, food, comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the hotel is located very close to Whole Foods Market and Chipotle...
reviews.title: Exactly right.

reviews.text: (sorry it took me six months to write this review!)
reviews.title: This Hampton Inn is the BEST...bar none!!

reviews.text: Just stayed here, and was really looking forward to it based on the previous reviews. The location is good, close to a mall and interstate, but I found this hotel disappointing. We checked in just after 3pm, and there were only 4 other cars in the parking lot, so not busy. We are Hilton Honors members with preferences on our account for a high floor room away from elevator and ice, and we had booked a king bed. We get to the room to find out it has two queen beds, is a low floor, and is the room right next door to the elevator and ice machine!!!!Plus, I look out the window and the interstate is right there! Then I realize there is no refrigerator in this room at all, we travel a lot, and you kind of expect that now, so I was a little surprised. I called reception and pointed out the issues, they offered to switch my room if I came back down to reception, but we had to get somewhere, so I didn't have time to do that. I asked about a refrigerator and was told I would need to pay an extra $30 and upgrade my room to get one. That would make my stay over $100 per night, crazy for a Hampton Inn. This hotel also feels a little old and dark, I have stayed at much better locations, with much better customer service. Very disappointing.
reviews.title: No refrigerators in Standard Rooms, Really???
Hampton Inn Greenville - great service, good food!
reviews.text: I've been happy with most of my stays at the Hampton Inns and this one has been the BEST so far! There has been nothing left for want, cookies when I get back from the office, a full warm breakfast in the morning, and a nice dinner with wine in the evening, all included! Can"t think of a better way to travel than to make sure when we do business in Greenville, to stay at this great property.

Hotel had good beds, functioning hotel room, and good free breakfast. Good value for the money. Easy access to Greenville and Spartenburg. Only one problem - getting out or in requires fighting traffic.
reviews.title: Good hotel - near everything - tough turn off the main road

reviews.text: We stayed here while visiting family. The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly. The breakfast is quite complete with a lot of options, including hot menu items. We did have our key card rekeyed about four times during our one night stay, which was rather annoying. The hotel is nice and met our needs but I wouldn't say it's anything special. It's a good place to sleep while passing through town.
reviews.title: Good Hotel Breakfast

reviews.text: I stayed here while on business. Handy for interstate and outlying business districts. Not the choice if you wish to be on the doorstep of city centre amenities.
reviews.title: Convenient for interstate and outlying business districts

reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I recently stayed here when we came to Greenville for a concert. I called the evening before to book a room and asked if an early check in was possible, The gentleman said that there would be no problem with that and was very courteous while making the reservation. When arrived at 1pm and the woman was very friendly and helpful and let us know about the breakfast in the morning. When we got up to our room everything looked and smelled clean. We had a room on the side of the hotel opposite the highway. The room was quiet and the beds comfortable and we all slept very well. The breakfast was very good with extras like western omlettes, potatoes and waffles. Overall this hotel is clean, in a great location and has great staff. Will stay here again when we come to Greenville.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.text: Danelle was the most fabulous host that we have ever had in a hotel, and hope to see her again.
reviews.title: Complimentary Breakfast

reviews.text: Stayed here a few times... I HATE the intersection its at... Needs a light... Takes me 20 minutes to get out... Great location for restaurants and downtown not far... Visiting downtown is a must.. Great restaurants, bridge, nightlife... Hidden gem this town...
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: Hotel is clean.. Staff very accomodating and nice... Breakfast is good and they serve a complimentary dinner-which is nice if youre stuck working...
reviews.title: Staff are fantastic!!

reviews.text: Rooms are decent sized... Very clean, quiet hotel... Except our room...
reviews.title: All around wonderful experience

reviews.text: We stayed at this Hampton Inn for one night in July 2011. The entire hotel was very clean, and looked new or recently refurbished as there was no wear on carpets, etc. What made this hotel outstanding to me was the staff. There were many individuals with disabilities staying during the same time, and we observed the staff truly showing excellence in serving these guests, particularly in the breakfast area, where the food is not at a convenient height for someone in a wheelchair. The only negative I have to give about this hotel is that it sits right on the interstate, and if your room happens to be on that side of the hotel, which ours was, you do hear the louder vehicles as they travel during the night. We will know next stay to request a room away from the interstate.
reviews.title: Clean hotel with great staff

reviews.text: We stayed here to visit family in town. The hotel was close to nearby eating places (PF Changs, Red Robin, Chilis) and shopping (Barnes and Noble, Petsmart, etc). The hotel staff was very friendly (shout out to Bethany who was there the night we checked it) and told us some places to visit while we were there. THe hotel was very clean, had comfy beds and the pool was clean. Continental breakfast was more than an apple and a piece of toast. The day we ate it included eggs, sausage gravy and biscuts, as well as english muffins, danish, fruit, yogurt, cereals, etc. Cookies were out at night.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: This Hampton Inn was just fine.
reviews.title: Clean room; Good location!

reviews.text: As previous reviewers have mentioned, it was very clean and the staff friendly & helpful. The breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Nice Quiet hotel

reviews.text: The location just off I385 & Woodruff is very conveniently located. Doesn't take long to get downtown or to other parts of Greenville.
reviews.title: Good location, clean, nice amenities

aka: Hampton Inn Greenville i-385 - Woodruff Rd. Hotel Greenville
description: The Hampton Inn Greenville Woodruff Road, SC is located in the heart of Greenville. Our 116 guest rooms feature king rooms with speaker phones, executive desk and chair, king study rooms with microwave/fridge units. Free high speed internet access, complimentary hot breakfast, in-room coffee maker, hair dryer, voice mail, TV with cable, business center, fitness center and outdoor pool.
